alert.note: Alert for Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A heavy thunderstorm will impact portions of western Wirt and southeastern Wood Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1044 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a heavy thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Elizabeth, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Elizabeth, Mineralwells, Peewee, Freeport, Walker, Davisville, Greencastle, Morristown and Palestine. This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 162 and 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
